chapters.title: The Nature of Volatility Trading and Implied Volatility

book_structure.key_feature: Each chapter ends with Key Takeaways summary page

implied_volatility_edge.implication: Premium sellers have statistical edge when IV > RV
implied_volatility_edge.action: Sell options when IV is elevated (IV Rank 50-100%)
implied_volatility_edge.analogy: Like owning the casino - consistent small wins, occasional large losses

theta_ratio_guideline.rationale: Balances income generation with tail risk management

kelly_criterion_adapted.principle: Optimal bet sizing based on edge and probability
kelly_criterion_adapted.application: Allocate more capital to higher probability opportunities
kelly_criterion_adapted.constraint: Never bet so much that a loss wipes you out
kelly_criterion_adapted.adaptation: Modified for options to account for asymmetric payoffs

cvar_tail_risk.definition: Conditional Value at Risk - expected loss beyond VaR threshold
cvar_tail_risk.action: Size positions to survive CVaR events
cvar_tail_risk.rationale: Standard deviation understates tail risk in options

greeks_portfolio_management.theta: Daily expected profit from time decay
greeks_portfolio_management.gamma: Rate of delta change - danger accelerates near expiration

buying_options.pattern: Frequent small losses, occasional large wins
buying_options.psychology: Requires patience for rare big wins

selling_options.pattern: Frequent small wins, occasional large losses
selling_options.edge: Statistical advantage when IV > RV (positive expected value)

position_sizing.method: Use CVaR to estimate tail losses
position_sizing.never: Never bet so much that one loss wipes account

outlier_protection.solution: Size small enough to survive them

recommended_additions.implementation: Check IV Rank on SPY/IWM before trades
